instantiatesCanonical: Decision to Screen

subject: Joanne Smith

action

id

SDMContinueScreeningLifeExp

title: Discuss decision to continue screening

description: ACS advises that individuals should continue colorectal cancer screening as long as their overall health is good and they have a life expectancy of 10 years or more. Decision to continue screening in cases of limited life expectancy should be based on shared decision-making.

Documentations

-TypeLabelDisplayCitation
*CitationACS 2018Colorectal cancer screening for average‐risk adults: 2018 guideline update from the American Cancer Society

Wolf, A. M. D., et al. (2018). Colorectal cancer screening for average‐risk adults: 2018 guideline update from the American Cancer Society. CA: A Cancer Journal for Clinicians, 68(4), 250–281. https://doi.org/10.3322/caac.21457

resource: Bundle: type = collection

action

id

HereditarySyndromesSurveillance

title: Colorectal cancer surveillance per specialist recommendations

description: Refer to GI specialist for colorectal cancer (and possibly additional cancers) surveillance recommendations. Patients with a hereditary cancer syndrome require specialized management and colonoscopy surveillance for colorectal cancer (as well as additional surveillance for other cancers). Recommendations on when to start surveillance and surveillance intervals vary according to the syndrome.

Documentations

-TypeLabelDisplayCitation
*CitationACG Hereditary Syndromes (2015)ACG Clinical Guideline: Genetic Testing and Management of Hereditary Gastrointestinal Cancer Syndromes

Syngal, S., et al. (2015). ACG Clinical Guideline: Genetic Testing and Management of Hereditary Gastrointestinal Cancer Syndromes. American Journal of Gastroenterology 110(2):p 223-262. https://doi.org/10.1038/ajg.2014.435
